column1: Smoque BBQ////I found Smoque at Revival Food Hall. As a native Texan
column2: I am generally skeptic of barbecue spots outside of the south. In order to gauge authenticity
column3: asked the food line workers if the owner or chef was from Tennessee
column6: considering their three sauce options. They didn't know
column7: but directed me to the owner
column9: who was sitting at the end of the counter. He was very friendly and chatted with me a bit. He explained that he was from Chicago
column10: but spent some time in central Texas
column11: which inspired their smoked turkey. He gave me samples of that and the sliced brisket (unfortunately they were out of the sausage). The brisket was fantastic - so tender! I highly recommend it.
